Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Representative Pit of start zones on the summit. Ifrc widespread and thick in most areas. In isolated areas the Ifrc is thin and some isolated areas the FCsf have collapsed, creating small 10-15m biscuits, cracks do not continue past upper FCsf. ECTP20-25 results lower Mfcr/Fc laminate (210830) in 50 % of tests today. No concerns at precent with any hazard but worth keeping an eye on.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Very tough digging. S-F-L potential...Smooth sub surface. Has had a rain event recently during lockdown.
IFbi not found everwhere.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Profile dug in an obvious area of old isolated wind loading from early in lockdown, most of the mountain does not have this wind loading. Also tests elsewhere in the this old Swd produced ECTX results with no density observed. Main concern is the widespread 6mm SH with further snowfall if its not destroyed.
Average depth in SZ >3m. 210628 Ifrc seams to have broken down in most areas on this slope. IFbi can be found in most areas on this slope not all and in those areas DH sits on ground.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Ski area has been closed since 20210818, today was the first day that we were allowed back to investigate the snowpack. A even MFcr covers the summit slopes. Several size 1 Lw and Swt were observed on N1/2 below 1,800m, failing at ground level. It appears that these have failed in the last 48/72 hours.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: w/ Simon Howells Lower pack is laminate of multiple crusts with facets/DH above and below. Some striations evident. Appears to be breaking down?

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche; Ski tracks on slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Fracture line profile. Skier had jumped off a rock, triggering the slab. 6 previous tracks on slope.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area; Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Snowpack was of considerably hardness, isolating columns during compression tests was difficult to achieve. Near surface faceting was observed in top 15cm of the snow pack. The MFcr on the surface was 9cm thick. Failures on the near surface facet layer were not observed. In the next 12 hours we are expecting to receive 6cm Hn24 with wind from the SW. We are not expecting that the new snow will not be enough loading to trigger deeper instabilities in the snowpack.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Mid pack rounds have sintered into extremely hard slab after warm system 210801. No results on DHxr at lower pack. Crusts were not as prevalent in this test location as elsewhere on similar aspects.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes:
Attempted PST. Difficult to get saw to drag through weakest layer due to poor saw quality and non uniform crust layers blending together through the column.
Thin MFcr above well bonded RG, due to warming temps of 210801. Multiple old rain crusts beneath with DH sandwiched between, rounding in upper layers. MF and Basal iceforms to ground.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Previous explosive control work has not penetrated the lower crust. ECTN representative of what we have been seeing with control work. When Isolating the entire column could not get an ECT result on lower IF/FC interface.

Nýsnævi er að finna ofan á þykku hjarni. Nýsnævið hefur skafið og er misþykkt.
Þar sem ekki er nýsnævi er þunn skel sem brotnar þegar gengið er ofan á því.
Í 8 cm er að finna veikt lag sem gæti brotnað ef mikill snjór kemur ofaná. Þó teljum við veikasta lagið vera í 18 cm, en þar brotnaði fyrst í samþjöppunarprófi.
Inget test endast hårdhet och temp. Litet fält i ett område med klippor, mossa.
HS >280. Större fält. Överlag torr snö i i området, undantaget översta 10cm-M CT27 SP kan ha varit RP, men blocket gled av. Glidytan 40 grader.
Liten läsluttning. HS >280 CT test: Möjligen CTH RP @73

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Pit dug in SZ of Goldstorm 7 avalanche path. Looking for presence and reactivity of the Nov4 MFcr/FC.

Pit_Observation.activities: Ski tracks on slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Intense solar radiation, a cloudy sky and the above freezing airtemp created very mediocre skiing conditions in the Heather Mdws area on 5/10/2021. The snow felt heavy and sticky. I did not appear that there had been an overnight surface freeze.
ALP. Område med mycket sten och lågt snötäcke. HS 135 men sågade bara ned 50cm.
ALP. HS >280. Stor flack sluttning. Vindpåverkad övre snöyta.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Pit dug in the SZ of Goldstorm 8 path. Assessing the state of the Nov 4 MFcr/FC interface. The basal layer is a laminate of K MFcr and 4F+ FCxr/DHxr 4-6.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: HS sond+. ALP, läsluttning.

This was a quick pit, estimated the profile from memory. Biggest surprise was the bottom layer of depth hoar still present after days of above freezing temps. The 10cm ice crust above it is likely holding the snowpack in place. Upper part of the snowpack was consolidated, with a couple thin ice layers.
ALP. Trång dalgång. Öppen yta, liten läformation.
